name: git-sync
description: Git-Sync is a CLI tool that schedules and automates synchronization between local directories and Git repositories. It works well for backups, content syncing, and versioning lightweight deployments.
features: Directory Synchronization: Automatically sync local directories to Git repositories for version control.
Scheduled Automation: Configure automatic sync intervals to keep repositories up to date.
Version Control Integration: Leverage Git's versioning for file history and rollback capabilities.
Conflict Resolution: Handle file conflicts with configurable merge strategies.
Selective Syncing: Choose specific files or directories to include or exclude from synchronization.
Lightweight Deployment: Minimal resource usage suitable for continuous background operation.
Content Versioning: Track changes to configuration files, documents, and other content over time.
Backup Strategy: Use Git remotes as backup destinations for important local files.
